channel.title: Helpz0r Kinda newb =)
channel.description:
Hey moparguys,
I've got a quistion bout a thing ive been wondering about like 6 months, well here i go: When i put my server online (StabbingScape 4.1) and i dont want to get online, open up the client 'n stuff, is there a way i can yell to people that are on the server? this is becuz my pc is kinda slow, and it takes like ages to run the client, soo yeh, that's all....

item.title: Helpz0r Kinda newb =)
item.dc:creator: @leatjuhh leatjuhh
item.description:
@leatjuhh wrote:

Thanks alot man, but i still dont get it completely
I’ve added the .JAVA files, and i went into client.JAVA, but where do i put those codes exactly?
thanks alot for explaining so far…

[quote=“Owned_Pl0xs, post:5, topic:318929”]Now go to your client.java, find your destruct method, and add this in there:

server.panel.removeListModelItem(playerName);

Now find your initalize method in your client.java, and add this in there.

server.panel.addListModelItem(playerName);

and finally, in your logout method, add this:

server.panel.removeListModelItem(playerName);

Finally, add these constructors in your Server.java

public static Panel panel = null;
panel = new Panel();

Don’t put them in the same place, BTW.[/quote]

How do i find my destruct method? :o
And the logout and the constuctors etc etc,
I’m sorry if i sound very noobish, lol
thnx

Read full topic

item.title: Helpz0r Kinda newb =)
item.dc:creator: @Owned_Pl0xs Owned_Pl0xs
item.description:
@Owned_Pl0xs wrote:

I’m assuming you have a delta.

Anyway, iPanel is a GUI made for navigating the server.

I don’t know if I’m aloud to post the code, but I will anyway.

If i’m not aloud to, I will remove it.

First:

Make a new file and name it Panel.java, and put this in it: (the contents can be found in the link below)

http://pastebin.ca/1712077

Make another new file, name it ServerUpTimeCounter.java this time, and put this in it:

[code]public class ServerUpTimeCounter {
private long startTime;

public ServerUpTimeCounter() {
startTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
Panel.uptimeCounterLabel.setText(seconds(0L));
}

public String fillOut(long paramLong, int paramInt) {
String timeString = “”;
for (int j = 0; j < paramInt - String.valueOf(paramLong).length(); ++j) {
timeString = timeString.concat(“0”);
}
timeString = timeString.concat(String.valueOf(paramLong));
return timeString;
}

public String seconds(long paramLong) {
long l1 = paramLong / 1000L;
long l2 = l1 / 60L;
long l3 = l2 / 60L;
long l4 = paramLong % 1000L;
l1 %= 60L;
l2 %= 60L;
return “” + fillOut(l3, 2) + “:” + fillOut(l2, 2) + “:” + fillOut(l1, 2);
}
private java.util.Timer timer;
public void startServerUptimeCounter() {
timer = new java.util.Timer();
timer.scheduleAtFixedRate(new java.util.TimerTask() {
public void run() {
Panel.uptimeCounterLabel.setText(seconds(System.currentTimeMillis()-startTime));
}
}, 0, 1000);
}
}[/code]

Finally make your last file and name it XMLConverter.java

[code]import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Dimension;
import java.awt.FlowLayout;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import java.awt.event.KeyEvent;
import java.awt.event.KeyListener;
import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileInputStream;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.InputStream;
import java.io.InputStreamReader;
import java.net.URL;
import java.net.URLConnection;
import javax.swing.*;
import javax.swing.event.ListDataListener;

public class XMLConverter {
private static String[] itemName = new String[10000];
private static String[] itemID = new String[10000];
private String fileName;

public XMLConverter(String fileName) {
File file = new File(fileName);
this.fileName = file.getName();
try {
FileInputStream fistream = new FileInputStream(file);
readStream(fistream);
} catch (IOException e) {
System.out.println("Couldn’t find the file " + fileName);
}
initUI();
}

private void readStream(InputStream inputStream) throws IOException {
BufferedReader reader = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(inputStream));
int linenumber = 0;
String[] clientline = new String[30000];
while ((clientline[linenumber] = reader.readLine()) != null)
++linenumber;
inputStream.close();
int y = 0;
for (int x = 0; (x < clientline.length) && (clientline[x] != null); ++x)
if (clientline[x].contains(“name=”)) {
String name = clientline[x].substring(clientline[x].indexOf(“name=”) + 6).replaceAll("".", “”);
String id = clientline[x].substring(clientline[x].indexOf(“type=”) + 6).replaceAll("".", “”);
this.itemName[y] = name;
this.itemID[y] = id;
++y;
}
}

private void initUI()
{
boolean oneFound = false;
String newLine = “\n”;
for (int x = 0; (x < this.itemName.length) && (this.itemName[x] != null); ++x) {
if(oneFound) {
Panel.itemNameList.append(newLine + this.itemName[x]);
Panel.itemIDList.append(newLine + this.itemID[x]);
} else {
oneFound = true;
Panel.itemNameList.append(this.itemName[x]);
Panel.itemIDList.append(this.itemID[x]);
}
}
}

public void search() {
String substring = Panel.searchPanel.getText();
Panel.itemNameList.setText("");
Panel.itemIDList.setText("");
boolean foundOne = false;
String newLine = “\n”;
for (int x = 0; (x < itemName.length) && (itemName[x] != null); ++x)
if (itemName[x].toLowerCase().contains(substring.toLowerCase()))
if (foundOne) {
Panel.itemNameList.append(newLine + itemName[x]);
Panel.itemIDList.append(newLine + itemID[x]);
} else {
foundOne = true;
Panel.itemNameList.append(itemName[x]);
Panel.itemIDList.append(itemID[x]);
}

if (Panel.itemNameList.getText().equals(""))
  Panel.itemNameList.setText("No Results Found");

}
}[/code]

Now go to your client.java, find your destruct method, and add this in there:

server.panel.removeListModelItem(playerName);

Now find your initalize method in your client.java, and add this in there.

server.panel.addListModelItem(playerName);

and finally, in your logout method, add this:

server.panel.removeListModelItem(playerName);

Finally, add these constructors in your Server.java

public static Panel panel = null;
panel = new Panel();

Don’t put them in the same place, BTW.

Read full topic
